bug_type: IndexError: list index out of range
solution: Verify that your list index is within the valid range. Use len() to check list length.
Declare variables before using them. Check for typos in variable names.
Use parameterized queries or prepared statements instead of string concatenation.
Ensure proper deallocation of memory. Use smart pointers (shared_ptr, unique_ptr) instead of raw pointers.
Verify loop termination condition and ensure the condition will eventually be met. Include a failsafe counter.
Use mutex locks, semaphores, or other synchronization mechanisms to protect shared resources.
Always check for zero before division operations. Implement try-catch blocks for division operations.
Always check buffer boundaries. Use safer functions like strncpy instead of strcpy.
Implement proper exception handling with try-catch blocks. Don't catch broad exceptions without specific handling.
Sanitize and escape user input. Use Content Security Policy (CSP) headers.
Always acquire locks in the same order. Use timeouts for lock acquisition.
Be careful with loop boundaries and array indices. Double-check array indexing logic.
Use appropriate data types for the expected range of values. Check for overflow before arithmetic operations.
Check for missing brackets, semicolons, or parentheses. Verify language syntax rules.
